docs.snippet: Venezuelans Vote On Term Limits     Images of Venezuelans voting on a referendum that did away with term limits on elected officials, and cleared the way for President Hugo Chávez to run for re-election indefinitely. The vote also amounted to a t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Venezuelans Vote On Term Limits Images of Venezuelans voting on a referendum that did away with term limits on elected officials, and cleared the way for President Hugo Chávez to run for re-election indefinitely. The vote also amounted to a test of his power after a steep fall in the price of oil; oil revenue has financed Mr. Chávez's broadly popular poverty-reduction projects.

docs.snippet: Every time I enter the subway after a show-Ruffian, say, with its campy French fashion queens-I wonder how I could possibly explain the clothes to mere mortals. Wool suits with rounded skirts and ruffled red satin dresses, all with black point d'e...
docs.lead_paragraph: Every time I enter the subway after a show-Ruffian, say, with its campy French fashion queens-I wonder how I could possibly explain the clothes to mere mortals. Wool suits with rounded skirts and ruffled red satin dresses, all with black point d'esprit bodysuits under them, might be unusually pleasing to a crowd in Times Square on Valentine's night. Such outfits, bordering on drag (a golden leopard knit minidress over the point d'esprit), might satisfy the public fantasy of fashion, just as the few remaining peep shows and dirty magazine shops still convey what this part of town used to be like. I had the feeling several times over the weekend-at the Vena Cava presentation, at Christian Cota-that each audience represented a separate tribe, and had come to look at the clothes and grab a free drink just as they would attend an art opening. Sometimes the clothes and the crowd seem unrelated.
docs.abstract: Every time I enter the subway after a show-Ruffian, say, with its campy French fashion queens-I wonder how I could possibly explain the clothes to mere mortals. docs.snippet: Rankings reflect sales, for the week ended Jan. 31, at many thousands of venues where a wide range of general interest books are sold nationwide. These include hundreds of independent book retailers (statistically weighted to represent all such ou...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rankings reflect sales, for the week ended Jan. 31, at many thousands of venues where a wide range of general interest books are sold nationwide. These include hundreds of independent book retailers (statistically weighted to represent all such outlets); national, regional and local chains; online and multimedia entertainment retailers; university, gift, supermarket, discount and department stores; and newsstands. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book’s sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above. A dagger (†) indicates that some bookstores report receiving bulk orders. Among those categories not actively tracked are: perennial sellers; required classroom reading; text, reference and test preparation guides; journals and workbooks; calorie counters; shopping guides; comics; and crossword puzzles. Expanded rankings are available on the Web: nytimes.com/books.

docs.snippet: NEUMAN--Shirley (Bilus), February 16, 1919. Wife of the late Edward. Mother of Barbara Masket (Samuel) and Andrea Rubin (Mark). Grandmother of Seth Masket (Vivian), Harris Masket (Sirena), Stefani Wulkan (Josh) and Eric Rubin (little Andy). GG of ...
docs.lead_paragraph: NEUMAN--Shirley (Bilus), February 16, 1919. Wife of the late Edward. Mother of Barbara Masket (Samuel) and Andrea Rubin (Mark). Grandmother of Seth Masket (Vivian), Harris Masket (Sirena), Stefani Wulkan (Josh) and Eric Rubin (little Andy). GG of Eli, Delilah, Adam, Sadie, Reggie and Oscar. Sister of Herbert Bilus and dear companion of Samuel Geltman. A tower of strength to all who knew her. Shirley's Place is now officially closed. Service Wednesday February 18, 11:30am, Gutterman and Musicant, Hackensack, NJ.
